The Hotel is literally next to 5th avenue which is the main street for restaurants, bars, clubs and shopping possibilities. There are 3 different restaurants (Mexican, Asian, Italian) which will satisfy your needs. If you need more options, you will find it close by. Most of the people book a All Inclusive room which will allow you to consume as much as you want in the hotel at the roof pool or lobby bar. The best thing is that you can use 2 other hotels from the chain which are at the beach (Playacar and Coco Beach). There is a shuttle bus in the morning and evening to these locations. It is highly recommended to take the ADO bus from the airport in Cancun to the ADO terminal in Playa Del Carmen. The station is next to 5th avenue. You can walk (15-20min) to the hotel from there or take a taxi (100 pesos). The ADO bus costs approx. 250 pesos per person from the airport, while a taxi will cost you 1'500 pesos. The Hotel has a small SPA with Sauna and offers good massages. Also, you will have a tour agency in the hotel lobby where you can book your trips to the pyramids, Holbox or other places.

We visited Mexico for the holiday season, esp. new years eve. The new years eve dinner was nice and the party on the rooftop was also pretty good.

The rooms open from a big hall, and on the ground floor there is the Italian restaurant where the breakfast is served; this means that you can hear the noise of the plates, cutlery and serving early in the morning, plus you can smell the food in your room (although it wasn't that bad)
Due to the humidity of the location, your wet clothes and towels (if you have your own) cannot dry, and there is a musty smell in the rooms (even the not used dresses needed to be washed at home, because everything took the musty smell)
The number of sunbeds are limited, hence you have to be on the rooftop early otherwise you wont have one.
Finally, my biggest problem: I could not drink a perfrectly served whisky during my entire stay. If you ask it on the rocks, there is more ice than whisky, and lots of ice already melt into the drink; if you ask it without ice, they still put ice into it, if they manage not to put ice into the whisky, it is served in a glass you drink shots from.... what a problem, I should have drunk tequila instead, I know :)

The big one is that if you pay for all inclusive expecting to be able to use the other resorts, expect to be disappointed. There’s absolutely no space to accommodate other people.
